note.p: Career: Went to the United States with his father (1846); Assistant, US coast survey (1859); Superintendent, Calumnet and Hecla copper mines, Lake Superior; surveyed Lake Titicaca, Peru, and studied copper mines in Peru and Chile (1875); made dredging expeditions; studied coral islands; died at sea on board the Adriatic, returning to the United States

Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DAB; DSB; non preferred term from David Dobbs, 'Reff madness: Charles Darwin, Alexander Agassiz and the meaning of coral' (New York, 2005) - he went by the name of Alexander Emmanuel Rodolphe Agassiz all his life and when he emigrated to America and tool citizenship, late in life he found among old family papers a birth certificate, apparently valid, baming him Alexander Rodolphe Albert Agassiz.
References: J Corden, 'Web of Science History' project in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 383-388
